abstract: Groupon names co-founder Eric Lefkofsky as its chief executive, permanently replacing Andrew Mason, who was fired because of growing concerns about its financial performance; reports second-quarter loss of $7.6 million, or 1 cent a share, down from $28.4 million, or 4 cents a share, one year earlier; revenue rose 7 percent to $608.7 million from $568.3 year earlier.
lead_paragraph: Eric Lefkofsky, the new chief executive, had been chairman and interim co-chief since Andrew Mason was fired as chief in February.

headline.main: Groupon Names a New Chief and Logs a Loss of $7.6 Million
